alert.note: Alert for Eastern Columbia; Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Columbia; Western Dutchess; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 6:43PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ulster, northern Dutchess and southwestern Columbia Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 643 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Clermont, or 7 miles east of Saugerties, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kingston, Saugerties, Rhinebeck, Hurley, Woodstock, Livingston, Pine Plains, Clermont, Red Hook, Ancram, West Hurley, Saugerties South, Port Ewen, Kenneth L Wilson Campground, Lake Katrine, Olivebridge, Marbletown, Bethel, Veteran and Milan. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 19 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for east central New York.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Columbia; Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Columbia; Western Dutchess; Western Ulster
